verbose_text: Subsequent application of L-arginine to the ganglion nearest to the recording site, AG4, reversed the effects of L-NAME, leading to a decrease in cycle period of 579.8 +/-40.7 ms. Thus, application of L-NAME to AG5 increased the cycle period to 1.23 +/-0.07 while subsequent application of L-arginine to AG4 decreased it to 0.86 +/-0.07.
evidence: AG4, reversed the effects of L-NAME
